abstract:
A beautiful recent conjecture of D. Armstrong predicts the average size of a
partition that is simultaneously an $s$- and a $t$-core, where $s$ and $t$ are
coprime. Our goal in this note is to prove this conjecture when $t=s+1$. These
cores, which are enumerated by Catalan numbers, have average size
$\binom{s+1}{3}/2$.
